MODULE.name: WebView
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The `Webview` is the core container used for rendering your application code. You can control certain behaviors of the webview by using this API class.
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW_EB:
The `Webview` is the core container used for rendering your application code. You can control certain behaviors of the webview by using this API class.
> Note: There is currently an issue with hyperlinks on CE devices using the IE Engine: if you are attempting to click a link while holding the shift hardware key on the device, the link will not work properly. This is a known issue and is being worked on currently.
MODULE.MORE_HELP:
## Enabling the API This API is part of the `coreapi` extension that is included automatically. :::ruby extensions: ["coreapi"]
## JavaScript Usage Be sure to review the [JavaScript API Usage](/guide/api_js) guide for important information about using this API in JavaScript.
## Ruby Usage Be sure to review the [Ruby API Usage](/guide/api_ruby) guide for important information about using this API in Ruby.

PROPERTY.name: framework
PROPERTY.DESC: Same as System.webViewFramework.

PROPERTY.name: fullScreen
PROPERTY.DESC: Use full screen mode.

PROPERTY.name: enableZoom
PROPERTY.DESC: Enable WebView zoom. Use 'enable_screen_zoom' parameter in rhoconfig.txt to configure this value.

PROPERTY.name: enableMediaPlaybackWithoutGesture
PROPERTY.DESC: Enable Media playback without gesture. If set to true, the application can play some medias (video, sound) without requiring a user gesture.

PROPERTY.name: enablePageLoadingIndication
PROPERTY.DESC: Show page loading indication. On Windows Mobile/CE this property can be set only in config.xml: GUI\\HourglassEnabled. At Android use 'disable_loading_indication' parameter in rhoconfig.txt to configure this value.

PROPERTY.name: enableWebPlugins
PROPERTY.DESC: Enable / disable web plug-ins. Use 'enable_web_plugins' parameter in rhoconfig.txt to configure this value. This option only has effect on Android versions before 4.0 (ICS). It mainly affects if Flash content is displayed.

PROPERTY.name: keyboardDisplayRequiresUserAction
PROPERTY.DESC: Attention: not worked with WKWebView! Can be defined in rhoconfig.txt as "WebView.keyboardDisplayRequiresUserAction" to 1 or 0. When this property is set to true, the user must explicitly tap the elements in the web view to display the keyboard (or other relevant input view) for that element. When set to false, a focus event on an element causes the input view to be displayed and associated with that element automatically.

PROPERTY.name: navigationTimeout
PROPERTY.DESC: Can be defined in config.xml: Navigation\\NavTimeout. Number of milliseconds(maximum is 45000) before the browser times out and navigates to the page specified in the badlink setting. If it is determined that the destination is unreachable regardless of wait time, the badlink may be loaded before NAVTIMEOUT. This is the time taken to establish communication with the server, not the time taken to fully load the page.Note that the navigation timeout will not be invoked when navigating to the start page, best practice is to store your first page locally to avoid connectivity issues at start up, you can then redirect to an online page if desired.

PROPERTY.name: scrollTechnique
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the technique used to scroll about the page.Defines in config.xml: Scrolling\\ScrollTechnique.

VALUE.DESC: No scrollbars will be displayed and the page will not respond to finger swipes.
When the size of the page is larger than the screen scrollbars will be presented which can be used to scroll the page.
You can scroll around the page using finger swiping.

PROPERTY.name: fontFamily
PROPERTY.DESC: Specifies the default font to use when rendering text in web pages. The specified font should be a TrueType font present on the device. On Windows the default font has been set to 'Tahoma' as this is present on all Symbol WM / CE devices, note that Tahoma has no italic or oblique variants. On the Enterprise Tablet the default is Droid Sans Fallback. The font specified must be stored in \Windows for Windows WM / CE devices, or /system/fonts for Enterprise Tablet. Defines in config.xml: HTMLStyles\\FontFamily

PROPERTY.name: userAgent
PROPERTY.DESC:
Defines in config.xml: Navigation\\UserAgent. When visiting a web server the WebKit browser will report its self as the specified user agent. Use the following substitution variables:
* %p - platform name ("Windows CE " + version number) * %w - WebKit version number * %e - WebKit version number.
Use the UserAgent setting to spoof your device to the server, e.g. to view content designed for the desktop on your mobile screen. From RhoElements 2.1 onwards the default value was changed to work out of the box with a greater number of server configurations, prior to RhoElements 2.1 the default user agent was: "Mozilla/5.0 (%p) AppleWebKit/%w (KHTML, like Gecko) WebKit/%e Safari/%w"

PROPERTY.name: viewportEnabled
PROPERTY.DESC: Whether to enable or disable viewport meta tag processing.Defines in config.xml: Navigation\\ViewportEnabled.

PROPERTY.name: viewportWidth
PROPERTY.DESC: Default viewport width to use for pages that do not have a viewport meta tag (uses 1:1 scaling if not specified).Defines in config.xml: Navigation\\ViewportWidth.

PROPERTY.name: cacheSize
PROPERTY.DESC: The browser cache size, in whole MBs. Defines in config.xml: Navigation\\Cache.

PROPERTY.name: enableCache
PROPERTY.DESC: Enable / disable Browser cache. Use 'WebView.enableCache' parameter in rhoconfig.txt to configure this value.

PROPERTY.name: acceptLanguage
PROPERTY.DESC: Configurable HTTP headers. Not yet implemented.

PROPERTY.name: zoomPage
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the zoom factor of the page. Factor 1.0 is no zoom, values less than 1.0 are zoomed out and values greater than 1.0 are zoomed in.It is recommended to not to use the zoom value less than 1.0 because the page doesn't look in readable format.In Android new Zoom value takes effect on current page, Previous page has to be revisited for the new zoom values to take effect

PROPERTY.name: textZoomLevel
PROPERTY.DESC: Sets the font size to be displayed on the page, set to 0 for the smallest font and 4 for the largest font.

PROPERTY.name: activeTab
PROPERTY.DESC: Return an active tab index. For change active tab use Use Rho.NativeTabbar.currentTab property.

PROPERTY.name: enableDragAndDrop
PROPERTY.DESC: enable drag and drop operations for iOS >= 11.0

METHOD.name: refresh
METHOD.DESC: Force WebView to refresh the current page.

PARAM.name: tabIndex
PARAM.DESC: TabBar tab index. If no tab bar present, index is ignored.

METHOD.name: navigate
METHOD.DESC: Force WebView to navigate to a URL. White page flickering during transition may happen if a controller action method doesn't return any rendered value, but instead performs a WebView.navigate(someUrl) call. It is important to avoid using WebView.navigate in Ruby action methods because WebView.navigate is intended to be used in callback methods asynchronously.

PARAM.name: tabIndex
PARAM.DESC: TabBar tab index. If no tab bar present, index is ignored. Please avoid of navigate in not opened tab - this is unsupported on Android.

METHOD.name: navigateBack
METHOD.DESC: Force WebView to navigate to the previous page using Browser back.

PARAM.name: tabIndex
PARAM.DESC: TabBar tab index. If no tab bar present, index is ignored.

METHOD.name: currentLocation
METHOD.DESC:
Returns the relative url (location) of the current page(without server and port); the last URL loaded to WebView from Ruby controller action.
If you open your page in WebView, and after it makes a few jumps by linking (for example, to outside web adresses for example), currentLocation will still return the initial url opened in WebView. Also, if you use JQMobile, current_location has the initial URL, but does not reflect the actual window.location containing the JQMobile additional address by adding #, etc. See currentUrl.

PARAM.name: tabIndex
PARAM.DESC: TabBar tab index. If no tab bar present, index is ignored.Tab should be loaded once to return current url.

METHOD.name: currentURL
METHOD.DESC: Returns the actual URL in WebView. This works the same as the JavaScript window.location.href.

PARAM.name: tabIndex
PARAM.DESC: TabBar tab index. If no tab bar present, index is ignored.

METHOD.name: executeJavascript
METHOD.DESC:
Execute JavaScript on the current page from your controller.
For most mobile platforms, WebView.execute_js has been implemented via redirection to URL with 'javascript:' schema. If WebView.execute_js used in an AJAX call handler method in the controller, it may lead to the situation where the success javascript handler will never be executed. This may happen because, at the moment of success handler should be executed, a URL of the page already has been changed. This means no handlers from the previous page are valid.

PARAM.name: javascriptText
PARAM.DESC: The call to the JavaScript method on the current page, such as "test();".

PARAM.name: tabIndex
PARAM.DESC: TabBar tab index. If no tab bar present, index is ignored.

METHOD.name: active_tab
METHOD.DESC: Use NativeTabbar.currentTab property: returns the current tab index.

METHOD.name: full_screen_mode
METHOD.DESC: Use WebView.fullScreen property: Switch to / from full screen mode.

METHOD.name: setCookie
METHOD.DESC: When WebView loads the specified url (either by selecting link or from calling WebView.navigate), it will add this cookie to the HTTP request.Not implemented for WebKit.

PARAM.name: url
PARAM.DESC: Set a cookie to be used by WebView for this url.

PARAM.name: cookie
PARAM.DESC: Cookie value in RFC format, for instance 'session=123;expires=Fri, 31 Dec 2010 23:59:59 GMT; path=/;

METHOD.name: getCookies
METHOD.DESC: Returns cookies map for specified URL. Crosswalk is not supported.

PARAM.name: url
PARAM.DESC: An URL to retrieve cookies for.

METHOD.name: removeCookie
METHOD.DESC: Removes cookie by its name for specified URL. Crosswalk is not supported.

PARAM.name: url
PARAM.DESC: An URL to remove cookie from.

PARAM.name: name
PARAM.DESC: A cookie name to be removed.

PARAM.name: removed_cookie
PARAM.DESC: A name of removed cookie if it was removed successfully

METHOD.name: removeAllCookies
METHOD.DESC: Removes all cookies for application's webview. Crosswalk is not supported.

METHOD.name: save
METHOD.DESC: Save current page to file system.

PARAM.name: path
PARAM.DESC: Path to the file / folder to save the page.

PARAM.name: tabIndex
PARAM.DESC: TabBar tab index. If no tab bar present, index is ignored.

CAN_BE_NIL.DESC: If tabbar index omitted then active WebView will be saved.

METHOD.name: set_menu_items
METHOD.DESC: Use Application.nativeMenu property: set native menu items.

PARAM.name: menuItems
PARAM.DESC: Map of menu items: name to action.

MODULE.PLATFORM: WM, CE, Win32, Android, iOS, WP8

SECTION.DESC: You can call the WebView and make it execute JavaScript code from a Ruby controller. This can be particularly helpful in order to reuse JavaScript functionality that is already included in your pages.

CODE.RUBY: #call javascript alert on the current page Rho::WebView.executeJavascript("alert('This is Webview.executejavascript function');")

SECTION.DESC: As an example, you can invoke JQuery Mobile's changePage.

CODE.RUBY: #call JQuery Mobile from a Ruby controller Rho::WebView.executeJavascript("$.mobile.changePage('#my_page');")

SECTION.DESC: You can also call your own functions.
From the Ruby controller we can execute the JavaScript function that may be in the view.

CODE.RUBY: #call a custom JavaScript function from Ruby Rho::WebView.executeJavascript("greet('John Doe');")

SECTION.DESC: The WebView can be set to use all the available screen real-estate by turning on "full-screen" mode.
This property can also be assigned to in JavaScript.
This is the section that will appear before the code block.

CODE.RUBY: #Force WebView to navigate to a URL. Rho::WebView.navigate(url_for(:action => :my_action))

SECTION.DESC: You can also navigate outside of your application, to an external site.

CODE.RUBY: #Navigate out of the local application and into an externally-served site Rho::WebView.navigate("http://www.example.com");

SECTION.DESC: This API is also available from JavaScript.

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: //Navigate out of the local application and into an externally-served site Rho.WebView.navigate("http://www.example.com");

SECTION.DESC: This is the section that will appear before the code block.

CODE.RUBY: #Force WebView to navigate to the previous page using Browser back. Rho::WebView.navigateBack

SECTION.DESC: The same method is available in JavaScript.

CODE.JAVASCRIPT: //Force WebView to navigate to the previous page using Browser back. Rho.WebView.navigateBack();

SECTION.DESC: Reload the current URL into the WebView. This is useful especially after having updated data that must be now shown to the user

CODE.RUBY: # Update database or variables here # ... # Refresh the current page to show new information Rho::WebView.refresh

SECTION.DESC: By default, "refresh" will update the current view. If you are using the native Tabbar and have multiple WebViews, you can specify which one to refresh.

CODE.RUBY: # Reload the page on WebView number 2 Rho::WebView.refresh(2)
